canonical_structure.name: UBX-MGA-FLASH
canonical_structure.description: Transfer MGA-ANO data block to flash

fields.name: sequence
fields.description: Message sequence number, starting at 0 and incrementing by 1 for each MGA-FLASH-DATA message sent.

issues: Minor spelling error in sequence description ('increamenting'), which reflects the original source text.
Uses name 'UBX-MGA-FLASH-DATA' which is the sub-type title for Type 0x01 in some manuals, rather than the primary message name.
Minor spelling error in sequence description ('increamenting').
Uses repeated_groups structure for the data array, which is an alternative modeling choice.

valid_variations.reason: The M9 manual specifically identifies the message by its sub-type 'DATA' (0x01) directly in the title header, whereas others use the parent ID name 'UBX-MGA-FLASH'.

adjudication.reasoning: Across all generations (M8, M9, M10, F10), the UBX-MGA-FLASH (0x13 0x21) message remains structurally identical. It consists of a 6-byte header containing a type, version, sequence number, and size, followed by a variable-length data block. Extraction 3's naming convention and Extraction 5's use of 'repeated_groups' are valid alternative interpretations of the same byte-stream structure. Spelling errors like 'increamenting' are endemic to the source documentation of several versions.
